solution_line_template: From the details given, the car has traveled {distance_after_1st_turn} meters at the 1st turn + {distance_after_2nd_turn} meters after the 2nd turn + {distance_after_4th_turn} meters after the 4th turn = <<{distance_after_1st_turn}+{distance_after_2nd_turn}+{distance_after_4th_turn}={calculated_distance_known_turns}>>{calculated_distance_known_turns} meters around the ring.
It must therefore have driven {total_distance_around_ring} total meters – {calculated_distance_known_turns} calculated meters = {distance_after_3rd_turn} meters after the 3rd turn.
